body_html:
1 these arguments should only be added to the files using git, for files downloading zips and tars they are useless.

you can find the files using git by usage of the variables GIT_REPOSITORY

2 when using shallow clones with GIT_TAG fetches will likely fail

3 So we need a cache bool variable controlling if
GIT_TAG should be used or GIT_SHALLOW. GIT_PROGRESS should be added unconditionally since it just showes the progress.
body_text:
1 these arguments should only be added to the files using git, for files downloading zips and tars they are useless.
you can find the files using git by usage of the variables GIT_REPOSITORY
2 when using shallow clones with GIT_TAG fetches will likely fail
3 So we need a cache bool variable controlling if
GIT_TAG should be used or GIT_SHALLOW. GIT_PROGRESS should be added unconditionally since it just showes the progress.
body:
1 these arguments should only be added to the files using git, for files downloading zips and tars they are useless.

you can find the files using git by usage of the variables GIT_REPOSITORY

2 when using shallow clones with GIT_TAG fetches will likely fail

3 So we need a cache bool variable controlling if 
GIT_TAG should be used or GIT_SHALLOW. GIT_PROGRESS should be added unconditionally since it just showes the progress.
